item.title: Report E-2024120070
item.description:
Report E-2024120070

Identified by scraper @ 2024-12-09T12:25:35+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-03
  • City: SANGER
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 4000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On December 3, 2024, one (1) 1-gallon pail of paint was damaged in transit and released approximately one-half (0.5) gallon of paint to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Environmental Safety and Health Consulting Services (ES&H) to remediate the impacted site. The crew utilized absorbents and hand tools to remediate the site. All waste was containerized in one (1) 55-gallon drum for disposal.

item.title: Report X-2024120429
item.description:
Report X-2024120429

Identified by scraper @ 2024-12-09T12:25:35+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-11-27
  • City: FORT WORTH
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: The shipment was discovered leaking during sort operations. Outer packaging: brown fiberboard box. Inner contents: (Printing Ink, PGII)1 metal can @1 Liter (leaked) product information is covered in white paint (R3843-183G13 White, 918441, CKSH03, CRGFS1719288). 1 plastic bottle, approx. 3-4 Liters, Printing Ink, PGII, (No Release) Product info: NLLFSOO31242. The shipper provided the SDS. The shipment was placed in a salvage drum and held for FAA investigation.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0

  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: The KAG Energy, LLC driver was delivering diesel fuel into the customer's storage tank when the connection between the hose adaptor and tank became compromised. This allowed approximately 15 gallons of diesel fuel to be released. Lone Star Environmental responded to the scene and handled the remediation.

item.title: Report E-2024120057
item.description:
Report E-2024120057

Identified by scraper @ 2024-12-06T12:24:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-11-09
  • City: DALLAS
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 0312 ET, XPO notified ERTS of a cargo release at terminal LDA. It was reported that approximately 0.35-cups of VALUE CLEAN DEGREASER AND CLEANER released from a plastic drum due to unknown reasons. The release impacted inside of trailer #3213840. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and determined that contractor assistance was required due to the corrosive nature. Terminal personnel declined assistance.

item.title: Report E-2024120059
item.description:
Report E-2024120059

Identified by scraper @ 2024-12-06T12:24:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-11-08
  • City: SAN ANTONIO
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 10:39 AM ET, with LSX contacted the call center to report a spill that occurred inside of a trailer in San Antonio, TX. The spill consisted of 1 5-gallon metal pail of MasterPro Refinisher Lacquer Thinner, which was found with a rusted over bottom, causing approximately 1 cup or less to seep out onto the bottom corners of the container. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the terminal, placed the contents into a 20-gallon metal drum with plastic lining.

item.title: Report E-2024120031
item.description:
Report E-2024120031

Identified by scraper @ 2024-12-05T12:24:28+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-03
  • City: WALLER
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On December 3, 2024, one (1) 55-gallond drum of printing ink was damaged and released approximately less than one (<1) gallon of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Coastal Environmental Solutions (CES) to remediate the impacted site. CES personnel utilized hand tools and absorbents to remediate the ink-impacted trailer floor. The damaged drum was placed into a 95-gallon overpack and all impacted waste and absorbents collected and containerized into one (1) 5-gallon pail.

item.title: Report E-2024120028
item.description:
Report E-2024120028

Identified by scraper @ 2024-12-05T12:24:28+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-11-22
  • City: SAN ANTONIO
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On November 22, 2024, one (1) 55-gallon drum of UN2922 was punctured and released approximately fifty (50) gallons to the trailer floor. R_L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Lone Star Hazmat (LSH) to remediate the impacted site. The crew deployed a neutralizer to the trailer floor around the damaged drum. The crew collected the damaged drum, then placed all UN2922-impacted materials into one (1) 95-gallon overpack.
